meanings.definition: To speak or write about something with great hostility or anger.
meanings.sent1: She inveighed against the unfair treatment she received at work.
meanings.sent2: He always inveighed loudly whenever his favorite team lost a game.
meanings.sent3: The cat inveighed against the closed door, demanding to be let in.
meanings.sent4: The thunder inveighed against the peaceful night, startling everyone awake.
meanings.sent5: The wind inveighed through the trees, creating an eerie sound.

meanings.definition: To protest or complain vehemently about something.
meanings.sent1: The students inveighed against the new school policy on uniforms.
meanings.sent2: The workers inveighed about the long hours and low pay.
meanings.sent3: The toddler inveighed against having to eat vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The waves inveighed against the shore, eroding it slowly over time.
meanings.sent5: The protesters inveighed in front of the government building, demanding change.
